channel.title: Webclient Error [rep++] (rics webclient)
channel.description:
[code]java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 218774561 in class file client at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 218774561 in class file client[/code]
Webclient page says "error click for details" -.-
Help....?!

item.title: Webclient Error [rep++] (rics webclient)
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:396297”][quote author=P A N I C link=topic=493466.msg3608137#msg3608137 date=1306292681]

hmm according to what the java console is saying that the ClassFormat.class (if it is one) has one error fix this
Incompatible magic value 218774561 is this coded in classformat.java?

No, you have no idea what you’re talking about.

Are you using internet explorer?

The magic value, is the first 4 bytes of the class which should be CA FE BA BE. But in your case, they are 0D 0A 3C 21, which translates into the ASCII equivalents of CR LF < !, which indicates to me that there’s a blank line, and then what looks like an XML comment.

google chrome.
[/quote]

Try running it in IE or Firefox to see if you get the same error. If you don’t than it’s a chrome problem.[/quote]
My explorer doesn’t work
webclient page: http://www.mayhemx.com/play.php

Read full topic

The magic value, is the first 4 bytes of the class which should be CA FE BA BE. But in your case, they are 0D 0A 3C 21, which translates into the ASCII equivalents of CR LF < !, which indicates to me that there’s a blank line, and then what looks like an XML comment.
[/quote]

Try running it in IE or Firefox to see if you get the same error. If you don’t than it’s a chrome problem.

java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 218774561 in class file client at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 218774561 in class file client

Webclient page says “error click for details”
-.-
